website_summaries.verdict: Easily convertible from a pole saw to handheld chainsaw, this model earns high marks for its surprisingly powerful 8-amp motor and the extended 10-inch chain.
pros: Optimal power for household tree trimming tasks
Handles limbs of moderate thickness, and the detachable head converts this model to a chainsaw for chopping up downed limbs
The extended 10-inch chain cuts the time to complete larger jobs
The pole extends up to 10 feet, and the ergonomic grip helps control the unit when fully extended
Corded power source allows users to keep working without needing to stop for recharging or refueling
cons: Some users report the chain may begin to detach if this model is used frequently for larger-sized jobs

website_summaries.verdict: Plenty of reasons exist to like this saw. It's affordable, durable, and easy to use and maintain.
pros: Corded saw is well built and sturdy
Offers plenty of power and durability
cons: Counterbalance and chain break might be helpful
Weight is a concern, as is its tendency to leak oil

customer_reviews.title: Cheap poorly engineered.
customer_reviews.text: One year old, light use trimming branches no bigger than 2 inches. Motor bearing failed and melted plastic housing causing electric motor to burn up. Bearings mounted in plastic, morons, really poor engineering. So a waste of 90 bucks and now looking for something that will last. But maybe thats what we are stuck with today cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: Vecair

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chainsaw pole
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw pole is horrible! I bought it because the good reviews. The package arrive and I opened it. I put it together, added oil and I started using it. Five minutes after I started working on cutting some small thin orange tree branches the chain came off. I am returning it to Amazon right away. Beware while you put the pole together it CANNOT be taken apart, what it sucks! So, I had to get a bigger box in order to be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: THE CADILLAC BOY

customer_reviews.title: pretty normal for a chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy and difficult to use as others describe. I used this to clear away branches from a large live oak tree in my backyard, then cut the branches into small pieces to burn. This saw worked all day and the only problem was that the chain became loose a few times and needed to be adjusted; pretty normal for a chainsaw. When you store it, be sure to drain out the oil or keep rags under the blade because it will all drain out; also, pretty normal for a chainsaw. After that one day of using the chainsaw, I purchased an additional chain to keep as a spare because I really love how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: k s 4 2 4 4

customer_reviews.title: Not operational from the beginning. Poor design and aweful built quality. Hands down my worst purchase @ Amazon. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled it and oiled guide bar & saw chain. Electricity line was tested live and positive. Pressed and held the throttle lockout then squeezed the throttle control. Nothing happened. Tried many ways to start it with or without the pole. No luck so far. Also noticed that oil leaks badly, both the throttle lockout and the throttle control are poorly designed, the throttle lockout button gets stuck once being pressed.
customer_reviews.author: Eden98

customer_reviews.title: The chain saw worked fine but the extension was useless
customer_reviews.text: I also had the same problem as mentioned below, the pole unit was DOA. The chain saw worked fine but the extension was useless. After the unit is put together the pole cannot be taken apart so I had to explain to the Amazon customer service rep. that it could not be put back in the box unless they wanted me to break it in half, which would not have mattered because it would not work anyway. Amazon was gracious enough to refund my money without shipping the old one back. These units have wiring issues, I guess your opinion of how it works would depend on getting one that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Summerwind

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Saw, wish there was an extension.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit surprised by the negative reviews I saw here! I've used mine for 2 years of heavy use on my 1000 foot long driveway and have had no signs of trouble. Folks, you gotta oil your chainsaw. Any chainsaw. My wife and I have taken to using a two person method of running it though. I hold the pole with both hands and she runs the switch. This eases the load on me somewhat and prevents dropping the saw at the end of the cut too. I came back here actually because I was hoping that the manufacturer made an extender to let me reach some higher branches. I guess I gotta make my own.
customer_reviews.author: Parallel

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. I underestimated the power of the saw.
customer_reviews.text: Handy tool. Worked well on soft wood branches up to 8". Cut down a 25' nuisance umbrella tree in a afternoon. Cut the branches in 2 ft pieces etc. One comment, there were times when the saw would not work when attached to the poke. Resolved the problem by removing the saw from the pole and reassembled paying close attention to the safety button on chainsaw near the trigger to make sure it is depressed when the side cover is bolted on.
customer_reviews.author: Me.

customer_reviews.title: Low maintenance Chainsaw on a stick.
customer_reviews.text: I've used gas chainsaws before, but I have never used an electric chainsaw until I bought this bad boy. If you are only cutting trees around your house, get this thing. It's much lower maintenance and easier to use than a gas chainsaw, and it will cut some wood. I cut several 8 " branches with this bad boy. So easy, you can even cut trees with dress shoes on (see picture for proof).
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: On/Off Mechanism stuck to On after 4 Uses
customer_reviews.text: Update 1/2019 - I have used this tool about four times since I bought it. The switch in the handle sticks to on, so you’re basically dealing with a chainsaw on the end of a long heavy pole that won’t turn off - not ideal. Original - It is exactly as described. I wasn't expecting it to be as heavy as it is. It is very hard to handle, especially with the handle extended. A very strong man would probably not have any trouble with it, but this middle-aged desk jockey struggled using it to trim my crepe myrtles.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P.

customer_reviews.title: Heads Up
customer_reviews.text: Is really for very small trim jobs. That's about it. I totally overestimated what this thing can do. Given all the positive reviews I though that would be able to use it for a little more than that. Well, it bit the dust in the third outing. Engine still running but probably the clutch or something connecting the electric motor to the sprocket broke. Lesson learned. I got myself a real chainsaw and bought a Husky. I did like the extension pole idea but again, unless you are built like Arnold is really difficult to make a cut with the pole fully extended for anything over a couple of inches in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Chain was VERY loose when I first inspected the saw, it was easy enough to tighten. Read the instruction manual, then, read it again. The saw works fine. One problem; when the handle is fully extended it would help if you have King Kong working with you, as the saw becomes very heavy and awkward, as almost all of the weight is at the far end. Would have been nice if they had figured a way to put the electric motor at the user end of the pole, and run a shaft up through the pole to power the chain. That would have increased the cost and complexity of the saw. Other than that, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: livinleon

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very well!! Not for weaklings though!
customer_reviews.text: It works great and cuts very well........but is very heavy to handle when extended. But hey.......the benefit to that is you usually don't have to put much or any pressure on the saw when cutting. The weight of the saw does the work. Just be prepared for that. In any case, a excellent saw for the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Anti-Socialist Nobama

customer_reviews.title: great little saw
customer_reviews.text: loved this saw. went thru branches like butter, only isdue was the trigger one the pole attachment didnt work to much room between the trigger and case ,fixed with a folded up piece of carboard. worked great till loaned to a neighbor who thought i was so gret he was cutting 2-3 foot thick logs all day till it burned out the plastic gears, some of witcg you cant find to replace . for light duty its s great saw but big jobs need a full size saw would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ma Lourdes B. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Just OK, I’m sure there are better
customer_reviews.text: I dislike how heavy it was because it’s both a chainsaw and a pruner, mine was defective and did not oil the chain at all nothing I did would change it. It has ample power, but on a pole it is quite heavy. My least favorite thing about it was the so-called safety locks that are required by law ... there’s nothing safe about safety locks. I was sending mine back, but the pole that extends is permanent, once you extend it it cannot be retracted again, I was forced to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Hiatt

customer_reviews.title: A Cardboard Scabbard? Really?
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is just like the one we have used for over 15 years. Great power and cutting speed, light weight, and well built. Now for the insult (IMHO) No bar wrench provided, a big negative and instead of a strong poly scabbard like our old one, you are provided with a cardboard sleeve? Shame on Remington and to save a couple of dollars. Just how long does Remington expect a "Cardboard" sleeve to last? Good thing we have the scabbard from our old saw and the bar wrench, too. Thus, only 3 stars. Way to go Remington...
customer_reviews.author: J. Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!  It's Our Second One!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. The first one finally died a tool death of great dignity after having provided us with many, many hours of clearing our property of large, wild bushes, small trees, and of course low hanging tree branches. It's a pretty darn good tool to have on hand. I am a woman and I found it very easy to operate. In fact, I cut the majority of the wild bushes on our property with this pole saw which were much too big to cut down with lopping shears.,
customer_reviews.author: Joannie

customer_reviews.title: Remington customer service was useless and suggested calling Jiabin
customer_reviews.text: The trigger that turns the chainsaw on failed after one use. I opened it up to see if something was stuck, that was a mistake. I found the part that is being troublesome, it immediately broke when gently pulling it apart. The trigger is made by a company called Jiaben and I CANNOT find a replacement for it. They have about 1 billion triggers available, minus the one I need. Remington customer service was useless and suggested calling Jiabin. After opening the chainsaw up and looking inside, I was very surprised to see what looked like a science class project. I am tossing this in the trash and purchasing a sturdy pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Huze

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price for such a powerful saw.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw works like a champ. Within 2 days I cut down 3 hurricane palms, trimmed several palms , and trimmed my 30 foot avocado tree in half. I used premium chain oil often and cleaned out debris in it often to avoid the chain from getting stuck or damaged. As long as you treat this chainsaw right and keep it clean while you are working with it , it will give you years of good use at a very affordable price. The fact that its corded did not bother me at all , even for the tall avocado tree. The pole saw attachment is great quality and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Hope the rest of the saw is of better quality than that latch
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using the saw this spring. The first time I used it, the latch that tightens it down when you extend the pole broke off. I did not put much pressure on the lever. I tried to contact Remington for help as it is less than a year old but no. luck. I will have to buy the part myself. Hope the rest of the saw is of better quality than that latch.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Calaway

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Wife's review since I bought and used it. Does a great job but is very front heavy but, that's where to motor is so it would be expected. I could only do so much and then we had to hire someone to finish a tree. I guess I need to work on my strength. In all honesty, the only part I could not do was one gigantic tree that was probably 30' tall and it was only the top that I could not trim. That's a lot of front heavy weight on top of a tall ladder to handle. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Close

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Saw!
customer_reviews.text: Man I love this saw. I used to pay a guy hundreds to trim my trees but now I can do most all the work myself. Have cut off up to 6" or so limbs. Will reach very high in tree, lightweight (after a 4 hours constantly using saw my arm did feel like spaghetti) but that's just fatigue. This saw will probably last a long time. Have used it now for two seasons with zero issues. Always look forward to using because I know it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Texstechfan

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but heavy
customer_reviews.text: My son in law assembled it very easily, but the problem is I had back surgery a year ago & this thing is a Kyle but heavy, especially extended, so it really bothers my back. Problem is my son in law said that in the directions it says once assembled it can’t be disassembled. So I guess I’m stuck with it. This is unfair cause you can’t tell if it’s the right thing you want or need until you assemble it?
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Spradling

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give no stars, that would be my rating. This item is cheaply made. Ordered 1 and had to return because it wouldn't work right out of the box. Replacement worked for less than 10 minutes. Something became loose inside and would only work intermittently if it was shaken. Once pole is put together it cannot be disassembled which makes returning item a HUGE problem as it no longer fits in original packaging. BUYER BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Awful saw-do NOT purchase!
customer_reviews.text: When pole is extended, it is so far out of balance you cannot lift it. Also, the power plug between saw and pole keeps coming apart. Just when you FINALLY manhandle the saw into position and press the throttle, it won't work: Power plug is loose again at the saw. I went through this numerous times. Translation: This saw is hard to use. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dipsy Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! My neighbors that have borrowed it all agree.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for limbing trees and making friends with your neighbors, that will all want to borrow... I had the previous model that leaked bar oil. This so far does not leak bar oil. It is a bit awkward when fully extended, but that's physics for your. I really like that I can take the saw off the pole and use as a tiny chainsaw. Only thing I don't like is the cord "keeper" setup, that just never seems to work/cause more problems than its worth.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nordberg

customer_reviews.title: Will it work today? Will it not work today??  Guess???
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this works on some days and not on other days using the POLE EXTENDER. I have taken this to be fixed once and I need to do so again. In the hand held operation this is a great little chain saw. If the pole worked like it should I would give 5 starts but not now. What is funny, is that the day I was called by the Suggested Repair Center telling me my Remington Chain Saw was working fine QVC had a special with a easier to use chain saw that I wish I had bought. I think this is going back.
customer_reviews.author: VENICE, FL Rob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pole-saw
customer_reviews.text: This pole-saw is amazing! It was heavy for my hubby to use after a while, & he is stronger than the average guy. He said it was a good shoulder workout. We switched between the chainsaw and pole-saw with ease. We trimmed the brush around the mailbox, 2 trees, & 1 overgrown bush, all in 1 hour & 15 minutes! The extension on this thing is amazing. We cut down limbs that were taller than the house w ease. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: Open the box and the trigger was frozen like so many have stated. I do not understand why they do not fix it and keep selling the junk. Problem with return is once the handle is put together you cannot disassemble so it no longer fits into the box. So now have to create some sort of box so I can return. Shame on me for not reading the reviews ahead of time as many have had issues with the bad switch.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Adams

customer_reviews.title: The pole DID NOT WORK at all.  So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I just tried to use my Remington RM1025SPS Ranger 10-Inch 8-Amp Electric Chainsaw/Pole Saw Combo yesterday, Oct. 6, 2017. I found out that with the pole saw, the chainsaw did not work. I took off the pole saw, the chainsaw work! The reason I bought this, is the hard to reach branches that I wanted to cut. But with the Pole saw not working, it is useless. I followed the instruction carefully when I assemble it, and checked everything if it’s hooked, still did not work at all. Please advice me what to do with it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: It never worked
customer_reviews.text: This product didn't work as soon as we pulled it out of the box this spring. The chainsaw worked but not the pole attachment. The company this was purchased through is terrible to deal with. It takes at least 30 minutes to get a representative to talk to. They are going to replace the pole saw but needed my proof of receipt. I sent the receipt immediately, a month later I call back to check on status of order and they got my receipt the same day I sent it but never did anything with it. I feel like I should receive my money back and the pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Howell

customer_reviews.title: Non functioning, right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Non functioning, right out of the box. To make matters worse, I foolishly assembled the pole before ensuring the saw actually functioned. On return I had to purchase 2 of the longest boxes UPS had ($26.50) because the pole does not disassemble once assembled, so it would not fit into the original packaging. This was my first Remington purchase and it will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, gets a little heavy after some use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now, and I am generally pleased with it. I have used it maybe 7-8 times. I can take down some branches and then I like being able to take it off the pole to cut the branches up into smaller pieces. I've never had a problem with the chain or it cutting properly. it does seem to leak a little oil when not in use, but I just put an aluminum pan under it to catch any oil. After a little use, it can get heavy on the end of the pole and I'm a 200+lb guy. But overall, I'm satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Door Jive

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: Amazed me how well it cut trees and thick branches. I took 5 small trees down and it didn't fail. It can be a bit top-heavy if fully extended (which I would expect from any pole saw). Like the ability it can be converted into a chain saw quickly. And yes it does leak oil (a little) so I have it removed from the pole and laying flat and no problems. It doesn't come with chain saw oil. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Houston Guy

customer_reviews.title: Chainsaw on a Pole. Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this past weekend. Cut my Canary Island Date Palm. Cut easily but the chainsaw was a little heavy as you might image having a chainsaw on the end of a pole. I wasn't surprised only a warning for those unaware. I can used the weightlifting to increase muscle tone. Better than going to the gym! But after an hour of this you might have to rest and drink some cold water. Easy to assemble and yes I read the instructions. Nothing to it. I have a Live Oak (hardwood) that needs some trimming next weekend. I'll let you know how it works on hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B

customer_reviews.title: The older model is better! They both leak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the model before this one. And I broke it, after about 5 years of use. The older model is better! They both leak, but I just pour the bar oil back into the bottle and put a rag below to catch what leaks. They work well for the $. I just don't like how easily the newer model's handle pushes back into it's self. I have used these saws to trim "many" trees. Like 30 +. The old saw owes me nothing! And I wish I could purchase the old model again.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE S...

customer_reviews.title: Pole saw broken after a few cuts
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about receiving the Remington RM1025SPS Ranger 10-Inch 8-Amp Electric Chainsaw/Pole Saw Combo. The assembly was easy. Within half hour after opening the box, I was able to use the pole saw to cut small branches. After cutting a few branches, the pole saw stopped working. I removed the pole and plug in power code directly with chain saw, and the chain saw still worked. Decided to return for a refund and found I couldn't disassemble the pole. “once assembled they could not be disassembled.”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with this MFG - product is not working
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this MFG - product is not working, NO option to re-pack and drop off at UPS... Once Installed the pole it cannot be disassembled. Installed pole will not fit in the original MFG box it came in since it's 6 feet. Now completely stuck with this Junk, not fit in the BOX. Peoples are buying from Amazon without knowing how tricky the MFG is by having consumers hold the inventory regardless since installed pole cannot disassemble. Heads up to everyone - BEWARE.. I am victim, My money is gone and I am stuck with a crap I just bought. Lets not happen this to you..
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, would not start out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this saw after looking at reviews. Had some minor tree damage after Hurricane Irma, When I finally got around to putting it together and filling with oil the saw wouldn't even start, Additionally, the motor housing was not sealed/closed--horrible quality control, how can an the company package an item that won’t even work out of the box? After reading other reviews others have had the same issue, then they want you to take it to a repair center for repairs instead of replacing it. Terrible quality control, would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CLW

customer_reviews.title: needs an angled head adjustment
customer_reviews.text: The price point is good. The chain oil leaks out readily so maybe empty it after use. Bit heavy to hold over head when extended. Wish the saw end had an adjustable angle relative to the pole. it just sticks straight out, which is not very ergonomic and makes it awkward to trim a branch high up, you are forced to cut the side of the branch rather than top surface. When the branch gets cut it doesn't simply hinge downward. You have to cut to the very end, branch falls and so does the saw pole.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Saw works ok. It is too heavy to extend out, unless it is directly above your head. My wife bought this thinking she could trim branches by herself. She cannot lift it unfortunately. I can use it, but it aint easy. Just know what you're getting, it aint a walk in the park. But it does work ok. Lots of plastic on the business end, so 3 stars from me, as I'm not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: TexasPride

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine. For the price, and convienece.
customer_reviews.text: Like it don’t love it. Use it, works, generally happy for price. Handled some great prune jobs. Main issue—It throws the chain- a lot. Constantly. But it takes on big jobs if you don’t mind stopping to reset the chain which is annoying and not that quick to fix but not the end of the world for the price. Also wish the chainsaw came off the pole, still need to get a regular chainsaw due to this as it’s too heavy to use with even short pole on it.
customer_reviews.author: BDiddyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If you can reach with an extension cord, this is a great option
customer_reviews.text: So this has been one of my favorite cutting tools since I got it. You can really get some altitude if you combine it with a ladder (do be careful though, that lever action and physics will teach you a lesson in mechanics if not). Is also cool to be able to use the saw stand alone. Really does a great job when you don't need a full sized chain saw...and can reach the work with an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: CJ In Texas

customer_reviews.title: Trigger problem
customer_reviews.text: I had this item for a few weeks before using it, when a storm came through and snapped a small tree I was excited to break thing out. Unfortunately the trigger mechanism on the saw broke after one use. The trigger cannot be depressed, after reading some reviews here this sounds like a common issue. Yes this tool is inexpensive but I shouldn't have jerry-rig a tool after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Lee

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: When first tried to use it there was no power to the saw. Couldn't find any way on Amazon to return it, and once assembled can't be disassembled. So you have a 10 foot long item to package for return. As a last resort I disassembled the switch handle, collected the parts that went everywhere, reassembled it a couple of times, and finally got the power to feed the saw end. Tomorrow I'll try to actually saw with it!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF 2017 MODEL!!!! Ordered first ...
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE OF 2017 MODEL!!!! Ordered first one and right outta box connected chainsaw part to pole saw. It didn't work cause the locking mechanism for chain saw seized up! Also remember, once you put this together, u can't take apart! UPS has to add an additional box on top of regular box just to ship. Decided to try another one. New one arrived and I started chain saw separately first and it worked! So I connected pole together and attached chain saw to convert to pole saw, and guess what? Locking mechanism seized up yet again!! Definitely a defect in locking mechainism!! Sent it back again for refund. Went to local Home Depot and purchased one. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pole trimmer worked great for the job I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: The pole trimmer worked great for the job I needed it for. I have some trees around the property that are relatively small. This unit did a decent job of trimming branches that were up to about an inch or two in thickness. The trees themselves were of a relatively soft wood, so not too tough. The unit is a little top heavy, which is to be expected, given the nature of the design. It makes it a workout when using the unit fully extended. This unit will work well for the cuts I need to make. It was very easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy maintenance. Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few years and it’s definitely exceeded my expectations. Easy maintenance. Quiet. Safe (no idling motor). weight allows for a very long pole to essentially lay the saw on high limbs. Cuts hard woods adequately and works okay off thepole as well.
customer_reviews.author: G.  Lock

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great delivery service
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great delivery service. VERY hand tool BUT naturally not built for abuse or long term. Chain drive sprocket gave up after 2 yrs of use around house for heavy tree pruning. This model allows saw to be removed from pole and used as a regular small elect. chain saw is handy but makes the saw heavier than more expensive competitors at end of pole when reaching.
customer_reviews.author: D Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and awkward
customer_reviews.text: IF you are Popeye or the world's strongest man, this may be just what you need if you don't mind the clunky oiling mechanism. While no strong man, consider myself in very good shape, but this thing is way too heavy to use when partially or fully extended which is of course just how you want to use it. Seems reasonably well made or it would be one *.
customer_reviews.author: Plumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for branches up to 5 inches up to 15 ft overhead
customer_reviews.text: Great saw... I used it this weekend. Took about 10 minutes to unbox and put together, put oil in it and get it going. Used it overhead for 2-5 inch branches with no problem. Very stable and pretty safe as far as holding a working chainsaw 15 ft over your head goes. Very sharp out of the box. Didn't bind. Did suck up some vegitation in the blade protector so took a second to clean it out after I was done
customer_reviews.author: G Price

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Does leak oil but it's best to store it with the blade pointing down and the saw in a 5-gal bucket. They seem to last forever. I have one that's at least 15 years old. The saw itself has outlasted the plastic parts on the pole/handle (but easy to fix). My take is these are much safer than a handheld electric or a handheld gas chainsaw (if you keep it on the pole) because of the increased distance between you and the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Liazard

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself and save money
customer_reviews.text: I've trimmed 3 trees in my yard and it's worked great. Saved me a fortune as I was quoted $150 per tree. Pros: Long Long Reach Cuts fast Strong - cut through thick limbs Not all that heavy Cons: Leaks chain oil when stored Birds nest fell out of tree (I didn't see it before cutting) while cutting down limbs and killed the babies. I felt bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: very good. I cut a lot of crapemertle limps 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: very good.I cut a lot of crapemertle limps 3 inch thick, did not slow down. The only problem I had was it was too heavy when attached to pole,but I am 80 years old and getting weaker.I looked along time before I decided to buy
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Mills

customer_reviews.title: Not a Stihl
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is well worth it. Not the greatest quality but for the price, I was surprised how well it performed. Trimmed my oak tree today and had no issues with 4"-5" limbs. I did change the blade to one that was made in the USA (Oregon S40) and it cut as good as my gas powered hand held. (4 stars for the cheap saw blade).
customer_reviews.author: Splinter

customer_reviews.title: Bad return process
customer_reviews.text: Item was faulty from the start. Power for the pole was defective. If saw was detached it worked fine. Once you assemble the pole, you can not disassemble it. This made for returning the product difficult. Each time I spoke with someone regarding the return, they kept telling me to put back in original package which cannot be done since it cannot be disassembled. Could not use the UPS pickup or Kohls drop off options. After finally speaking to two representatives and finally a Supervisor, explaining the issue numerous times and telling them to pull up the instruction manual regarding disassembling the pole to place in original box, I was given my refund and told to keep the item.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it July 3rd of last year and finally getting around to using it. Pulled it out of the box this morning and to my surprise it won't even turn on. trigger feels very cheap but I would expect at least a few days out of this before it breaks down. Don't waste your money, I'm looking into returning it but like the other reviews it's barely worth it after paying $70 dollars to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Beads of Time

customer_reviews.title: This thing shocked me how great it cuts
customer_reviews.text: This thing shocked me how great it cuts. I literally took down a large tree and cut up all the branches so green waste would take it away. Note I used it as a hand held chain saw and did not use the pole at all. The branches alone covered my entire yard. It never faltered for a second. I've had serious gas powered chain saws to compare this too. Now it's not that but it did the job great! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Menke

customer_reviews.title: Worst - Plastic gears in chain saw and heavy to lift as a pole saw
customer_reviews.text: The worst pole saw ever. The gears in the chain saw is PLASTIC! I replaced once and got damaged soon again, then threw it away. This is the first tool that I discarded actively because of its own quality among tens of electric tools I owned. It can’t be used as a pole saw, either. Too heavy to lift or safe to operate. You won’t feel surprise to see it’s low ratings once you use it. I got a good lesson and will never buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rational_Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very top heavy
customer_reviews.text: We have not actually used this pole saw yet but I wanted to write a review. I bought this pole saw for my Mom to do her own yard work, my mom is in great shape and has no issues working in her yard daily. This pole saw is very top heavy and difficult to maneuver so she is unable to use it on her own.
customer_reviews.author: molly nichols

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use - Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Took 60 seconds to read the manual and put together. Trimmed branches up to about 6 inches in diameter. I couldn't be happier with this unit. Is it heavy? You'll get a workout, but nothing is for free - you need some weight to be able to cut through larger branches. I found it very usable. Can't wait to use it again, but I only have one big tree so it will probably be next fall.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Pole Saw stopped activating saw after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I used the saw for a few small cuts here and there, the first season. Then it sat in my garage until i needed it again. When i tried to use the saw this season, i found that the Pole switch would not activate the saw. I tried outlets, new extension cords, etc - only to find the other reviewers on here having the same issue. This common problem shows a design flaw in the Remington Pole portion of this saw. Will do more research next time prior to purchasing. disappointed and money wasted IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: It is easily changed froma pole saw to a hand-held chain saw
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not give this product 5 stars is its weight when fully extended. I am a healthy 68 year old with a strong upper body and muscular arms but it was difficult using the saw when fully extended. Other than this difficulty this product has met or went beyond my expectations.It is easily changed froma pole saw to a hand-held chain saw. I have already put several hours of cutting on the saw and it had performed very well. I would like to see the saw be equipped with an automatic oiler rather than a manual one but this is not a major issue. I would definitely purchase another one should the need arise.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Porter

customer_reviews.title: Bought this pole saw in May 2015, placed in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pole saw in May 2015, placed in storage, opened the box June 10, 2016 and followed assembly instructions. Chain saw works well, but when connected to the pole assembly, plugged into an extension cord, there seem to be no power going through the saw. Called the manufacturer twice, placed on hold for a total of 40 minutes. There is a two-year warranty on this item, just wanted to get a "pole replacement" if at all possible. There are no Remington-authorized repair/maintenance dealer in the Pensacola,Florida area. Hopefully, AMAZON can contact the vendor/dealer and assist me in getting a replacement pole assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Dionisio A. Magno Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small trees
customer_reviews.text: Great for small trees but that’s about it. It does it’s job well. Works ok on bigger trees but gets stuck often. The weight of the chainsaw is manageable but if you put it on the stick it’s really too heavy and tough to maneuver. This chainsaw isn’t the best but you get what you pay for. Descent quality for the price. If you only have a to cut down one or 2 big trees just go to Home Depot and rent a big chainsaw for $50/day
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little saw
customer_reviews.text: This little saw kicks ass. I got it as a limb pruner but detatching the saw from the pole allows you to use the saw on tree trunks and cutting up wood. My 16" saw crapped out so I used this electric one successfully to cut down a couple of 10" dia trees and cut them up. Uses regular 10w30 motor oil for the bar oil.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - open and use immediately - missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I had not written any negative reviews here (on anything). I purchased this as a gift for my father (even paid shipping). When he finally got around to using it, it was missing parts. There was a 1-year limited warranty on parts and labor. "Warranty service is available, WITH PROOF OF PURCHASE THROUGH YOUR LOCAL AUTHORIZED SERVICE DEALER." If something is unused due to missing parts. Now the warranty is expired and my father has an unusable piece of equipment. Sad. Now what?
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Only after a couple of uses, the safety trigger and and the main trigger jammed. I had to fix it myself and i was able to finish the job. Note: Upon fixing, I found that the spring and there is a plastic that broke that connects to the safety trigger. Now , the safety trigger is not working at all but atleast the main trigger still works.
customer_reviews.author: ellie

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing about 3 years ago. I know I have used it for less than 45 minutes in total. The saw is way too heavy making it very difficult and dangerous to use. The extension lock is made of cheap plastic and broke off in my hand. Cheap junk!
customer_reviews.author: PopThinks

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: When we first started using this it was AWESOME!!! It did a ton of work. My husband was all over the yard with it. Cutting limbs that were probably too big and even a couple of small trees. We have a very large yard and about 1/2 acre of woods in the front of the house. It has started to get dull and is a little hard to sharpen. It does leak oil if you don't store it correctly. With those few drawbacks.... this was a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: ent

customer_reviews.title: Built from cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The lever housing that locks the extension pole broke after using this saw four times. The pole will not stay extended now. This part is not replaceble and a new pole needs to be purchased acoording to Remington Customer Service. $45 plus shipping and the part is backordered until who knows when. Not worth replacing. I will be purchasing another brand to replace this chainsaw. Don't waste your money like I did. Pay a little bit more and get a quality brand saw
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: well worth the money. I had to pay tree service to get trees trimmed but i never had to call anyone since i owned this magical tool. I was surprised with how big of tree branches it can handle and the extension is very useful feature. I have had it for years with no issues and almost maintenance free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A 10 inch workhorse, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Put it to work one hour after receiving it, and again the next day. I have a 30 foot dead tree, and this Remington worked like a charm cutting through the large tree limbs. I'm totally satisfied with it. UPDATE: I've used this Remington again today, and it's one heck of a chainsaw. It works extremely well. No problem at all cutting through large limbs. If you're looking for a chainsaw-workhorse, get this one !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Functional chainsaw and powerful enough. But rough around the edges.
customer_reviews.text: The saw works very well but there are problems: 1. No chain guard 2. The automatic oiler doesn't seem to work 3. The clamp handle that allows the handle to telescope broke the first time it was operated. However, the clamp itself is not broken, just the poorly designed handle. You can use a 3.5mm hex wrench to tighten the clamp and it will then continue to function as you wish.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Rehmus

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great tool. It is a little heavy to hold up in the air very long. I have used it to trim the tops of my two apple trees and have also used it as a chain saw to clean up some small brush and wood on the ground. The only issue that I have had is the oiler doesn't seem to work which I compensate by just running oil on the chain every couple of cuts. Also, the oil all runs out during storage. Otherwise it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Heavenbound

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Doesn't run coming out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this! Purchased a little over a month ago. Put it together and when I tried to use it, NOTHING!! It doesn't run at all! Had to do the job with a pole saw. So buy this if you want to spend 85 bucks and get a workout. Or just go to the gym. Plus in this case the return window for Amazon is closed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick5

customer_reviews.title: manual oiler
customer_reviews.text: This is a electric chainsaw attached to a pole. It has a manual bar oiler which means to keep the chain oiled you have to pump push down on a rubber button to force oil to the bar. This is an impossible task with the saw 8 feet away. There are lots of better choices.
customer_reviews.author: Xenonmstr

customer_reviews.title: Its a very nice pole saw and quite nice non-pole saw as well.
customer_reviews.text: The saw works well. The manual oiler seems a bit odd, but I'm probably just not used to it yet. It is really handy how the saw comes off the pole and can be used separately. It saves me from having to drag around 2 chainsaws for a job. In its first job, the little saw cut well through 4+" limbs with no trouble at all. I was rather hoping that its pole could be re-separated into 2 pieces it was shipped as after use to make it easier to store and transport but this doesn't seem to be possible. Its a very nice pole saw and quite nice non-pole saw as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ruined Father's Day gift
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately had to take in for repair before ever using it as it was not working straight out of box. After a few weeks got it back and used for about 20 minutes before it stopped working. Took back to local repair dealer and he was told that manufacturer would not cover it as 1st repair was too costly. So needless to say not happy that my Father's Day present was a total washout and now I have to get something else to compensate for failed tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice polesaw
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and use. Had more reach , power and nicer quality than similar pole saws in this price range. A little heavy when fully extended, but still manageable for 1 person on smaller jobs. Would definitely need to tag out to a partner if you plan on using this for an extended amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Ell

customer_reviews.title: Poor warranty support from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: The metal tip of the guide bar split into two plates after just a few cuts. The warranty is two years on paper, but next to impossible to get - you have to call Remington to locate a service dealer, then the nearest dealer (~20 miles) they referred me to said they did not service Remington... And the warranty says a guide bar is a wear items, so any problems with it are not covered anyway, even with the new saw, so I need to buy a new bar now.
customer_reviews.author: NewEnglander

customer_reviews.title: Detachable Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other brands of pole saws and have had issues with them immediately. This Remington caught my eye because it is detachable and you can use it as a hand chain saw and the chainsaw bar length was longer than other competitors. Awesome! Really easy to convert with a hand nut and adapter. The supplied chain though, dulled extremely quick. I purchased a couple of replacements and they are lasting much longer. Pros: Price, bar length, detachable Cons: Heavy when extended and could use an extra handle oh the pole, supplied chain dulls fast.
customer_reviews.author: scionicboom

customer_reviews.title: Limb Saver!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a little heavy to swimg around, but this unit keeps me safe from falling off ladders, which is why I bought it. As age marches on, I was getting a little leary of climbing trees/ladders with a regular chainsaw. This little 10" saw packs all the punch needed to cut 8" limbs in a snap. Might do bigger, but I haven't tried yet. Only downside is it's electric, and you're limited by length of extension cord. However, because it's electric this unit will probably prove to be much easier to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: dpantle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your out door tree clean up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who needed a pole saw to handle all the broken branches in the many trees around our property and my in-laws property. He was very impressed with how well it worked. He also said that it was much better than he had expected, better than the older, similar one (different manufacturer) he had that broke a few years ago. It is a good addition to his outdoor clean up tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done with pesky trees
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because our HOA does not trim the crepe myrtle trees like they're supposed to, and we're getting bugs and paint damage from branches against the house. This chainsaw made short work of the offending branches, and at a great price. Only bad part is, I have short arms so i could not wield it and reach the trigger. My husband did not have any trouble with that. Just remember to buy oil for the chain.
customer_reviews.author: BarbN Lesniak

customer_reviews.title: Maybe by tapping the safety button and trigger on the saw to the on position it will work better.
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations, but the power gets interrupted I expect because the safety button and trigger at the end of the pole is not fully in sink with the safety button and trigger on the saw itself. So the button and trigger need to be manipulated often to get it to work. Maybe by tapping the safety button and trigger on the saw to the on position it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Ruminator

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: The saw cuts great. The only negative that I have found is the oil leakage. I don't fill the oil tank very full. Even when the unit is not being used, it leaks. However, other than than I have cut down 14 inch diameter trees and numerous limbs with the saw attached to the. pole.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Hall

customer_reviews.title: It suits my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I wish the saw was able to pivot, other than that, it suits my purpose, light enough, yet powerful enough to cut through some pretty big limbs
customer_reviews.author: Inspector 12

customer_reviews.title: Seems very sturdy, works great
customer_reviews.text: Seems very sturdy, works great. A very powerful little chainsaw. I've cut up logs, limbs, etc up to 8 - 9" across with very little strain on the motor. I subtract one star for the poor chain oiling system. I don't think the cheap plastic pressure bubble for manually oiling the chain works very well, nor do I think it will last very long. I keep an old fashioned oil can handy and manually oil the chain with that. As some reviewers already stated; it is heavy, and can be awkward to handle when on the pole and extended. But I don't imagine the pole and assembly would be as sturdy as it is if it was built any lighter.
customer_reviews.author: sykes

customer_reviews.title: Best outdoor tool you'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best $90 you'll spend for this must-have tool for anyone with 1 or more trees on their property. Not only can you cut off limbs from your trees up to 15'-20' up, you can then remove the pole and use the saw as a light-weight hand-held chainsaw. And if you really wanted to, you could cut down medium-diameter trees up to about 14". By far the best $90 I've spent for any outdoor tool - period. This saw will pay for itself over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy K. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Powerful , crafty , and compact Remington cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Straight to the point . Pros: Strong cutting saw for electric.8amp Pole contracts Lightest pole I used yet. Dule cuting : pole or without. Safety Triger Cheep Cons: I did not receive the screw to hold the saw to the pole. That is why I gave it 3 stars. Without the plastic holder and screw , it can not be attached. I made my own holder and screw. Saw gets tangle with debre fast , not bad , but over time. Need to get your own oil. Over all I would give it a 5 stars , but there was missing parts. So 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw, it worked well to cut some limbs of a neighbors tree hanging over my property and blocking sunlight to my garden. Simple to put together and cut like a knife through butter. I couldnt be happier. It is tricky to use because it requires a lot of core strength to stabilize once it cuts through. I was on a ladder also which didnt help. Be safe out there folks if you use this saw, take your time.
customer_reviews.author: joeboxer22

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It does the job when cutting but leafs keep getting trapped and the chain actually came off. Also it's way too heavy when fully extended, even for my decent sized biceps.
customer_reviews.author: Trainaholic

customer_reviews.title: How did I get along without this!?!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable! This has solved so many problems for me! Low hanging branches that are difficult to mow under, pruning my apple tree, taking out saplings that encroach on my foundation! It can be used with or without the extension handle and without any gas or batteries to manage! I simply could not be happier! I even waited a while before posting as I wanted to see how well this performed over several "projects". Still runs and cuts like new! I even bought a second chain for it, just in case - but haven't seen any signs of dulling yet!
customer_reviews.author: J. Beutel

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Makes trimming trees much easier. The chainsaw is a little heavy when fully extended but for me it works perfect. It also can cut some pretty sizable limbs & I love being able to use the chainsaw without the pole.
customer_reviews.author: lweetz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, good power
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw was easy to assemble and get going. Just 5 minutes from opening the box to ready to go. And that included skimming the instructions. As for the actual cutting, it has good reach and power. I considered dinging it one star (but didn't) because it could use more clearance in the area where the chain passes the motor. I was cutting low-hanging branches from my redwood and found that twigs and needles collected in the pass-through area. It was a minor annoyance to clean out, but I guess that is a necessary trade-off for the compact design required for a pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: SMOakland

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, well worth the money. Just got mine and trimmed lots of branches on several trees. Worked great. Don't bother ordering "bar oil" for this saw, it uses SAE 10, SAE 30 or SAE 40 weight motor ail depending on temperature outdoors. I cut limbs up to 6" with no problem (which was the largest I needed to cut). I had no kick backs but pinched the blade twice because I didn't follow instructions, lesson learned. The reach of this saw was very good and was easy to adjust. There was nothing I didn't like about this saw and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: motor is all at the of the pole but let me tell you this it works great no problem cutting through 4-6" limbs and when you ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying this unit is a little heavy when you have it fully extended,but that's to be expected the blade, chain ,motor is all at the of the pole but let me tell you this it works great no problem cutting through 4-6" limbs and when you are done limbing it easily converts to a chain saw quickly yo cut up the limbs! I bought straight 30 weight oil for the bar worked fine! Overall this is a great product would recommend it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: T. S. KOENIG

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This polesaw is a great value. It cuts well. It is heavy to support when fully extended, as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Performs admirably.
customer_reviews.text: A lot easier to use than climbing a ladder with a chainsaw. Sure, it's heavy, but I prefer to stay on the ground if at all possible, and this works great for that. Topped out two trees in a few hours and then proceeded to lop the limbs into firewood. My 18" gas chainsaw had been borrowed by family, so I ended up taking this guy off the end of the pole and working with it. Got the job done and would be more than enough for a typical homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: BklynCyclone

customer_reviews.title: Works well for elevated cutting
customer_reviews.text: Good saw for trimming larger tree branches otherwise out of reach. Easy to assemble. Not real heavy, a bit awkward due to weight on the end (thanks Archimedes). Requires a good high capacity extension cord (#12 stranded?). When cutting elevated branches, a George of the Jungle says, "with out for the trees."
customer_reviews.author: Fly BoyTop Contributor: Cooking

product_meta.title: Remington RM1025SPS Ranger 8-Amp Electric 2-in-1 Pole Saw & Chainsaw with 10-Foot Telescoping Shaft and 10-Inch Bar for Tree Trimming and Pruning
product_meta.description: When you need a little more reach, Remington has you covered. The Remington RM1025SPS Ranger 2-in-1 convertible pole saw/chainsaw has two adjustable aluminum poles that extend 10-feet to give you improved reach and stability while trimming. The instant-start, electric 8-amp motor powers through limbs quickly and the low-kickback 10-inch bar and chain give the machine more stability while lopping and pruning. When you’ve finished using the tree trimmer to remove branches from above, flip and lock clamps allow you to immediately convert the pole saw to a chainsaw and begin cutting the downed limbs. The Ranger is equipped with anti-rotation pole design for stability and a non-slip grip for added comfort. Includes bar and chain oil. Please refer to operator’s manual for guidance on use, maintenance, troubleshooting, and safety. Manufacturer’s note: It is normal for bar and chain oil to seep from the unit when not in use. Please take this into consideration when storing the unit. Backed by a 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: 2-IN-1 FUNCTIONALITY: Logs on the ground? Quickly detach the saw from the pole to convert the unit from a pole saw into a chainsaw. No tools required
LONG REACH: Designed with two aluminum booms extendable to 10-feet for high branches. With operator height considered, the pole saw can cut limbs 10-feet to 15-feet overhead
ELECTRIC POWERED: An 8-amp electric motor instantly starts to drive the chain over the low-kickback, 10-inch bar
ADJUSTABLE: A telescoping design paired with flip and lock clamps allow the operator to quickly adjust the length of the pole saw so that trimming trees of varying heights isn’t a hassle
PRUNE IN COMFORT: Anti-rotation shaft and non-slip grip enhance comfort and stability during use
NOTE: Bar and chain oil may seep from unit when not in use. Remember to loosen the saw chain if its tension was adjusted during operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,701 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
